basics.name: Arvydas Jonusonis
basics.label: Data Engineer
basics.summary: Independent, experienced backend/big-data Software Engineer and Cassandra specialist. Maintained large-scale (100+ nodes, 100k txs/sec) Cassandra deployments: automating and operationalizing the infrastrucuture, optimizing costs, while advising organization on Cassandra best practices. Led software projects from concept to market.

highlights: Led effort to segregate unsimilar Cassandra workloads into separate clusters to improve reliability and reduce infrastructure costs
Led migration of analytics Cassandra data from AWS to physical DC
Led migration of datamarts to Redshift
Led evaluation and integration of Airbnb's Airflow into the stack
Developed maintenance tools (Spark jobs) for migrating and purging stale data
Developed Mysql to Redshift synchronization tool powered by Amazon DMS
Contributed to automating Cassandra infrastrucure (using Chef)
Contributed to integrate Datadog as de facto Cassandra monitoring solution
Performed adhoc analysis of Cassandra data (using Spark)
Contributed refactor of the lamdba stack into a micro-batch-based kappa flow powered by BigQuery
Implemented turn-key metrics solution for micro-services
Implemented Cassandra support libraries
Led a Cassandra optimization/enhancement project, which involved refactoring existing code, automating repairs, changing compaction strategies, migrating data to a new cluster, upgrade
Contributed to big data teamâ€™s implementation of lambda architecture by refactoring event stream ingestion API to integrate with kafka

work.summary: A digital marketing platform for SMBs
highlights: Puppetized ActiveMQ deployments
Developed health-check library (Java & Grails plugin) for use in all ReachLocal web/micro-services
Led and executed upgrade of Cassandra (DSE) cluster (2.2.1 > 3.0.9)
Led development of a unified, global call tracking system (CTS), integrated with Twilio telephony platform
Led POC of Solr as an indexing mechanism for Cassandra data
Led major refactoring of secondary indexes and other Cassandra data to make more scaleable and enable a crucial upgrade
Led Cassandra upgrade (0.6x to 0.8)
Led implementation of company-wide, global notification system (e-mail and push notifications)
Led design and development of a distributed enterprise event-driven system (leveraging Cassandra and ActiveMQ)

awards.title: Founders Circle
awards.summary: Engineering dept recipient of top performance award and trip to Bahamas.
